title: Director, Procurement Job at Federal Polytechnic, Bida.
content:
Federal Polytechnic, Bida was established in 1977 following a decision of the Federal Government of Nigeria to move the institution to Bida. Before then, it was the Federal College of Technology, Kano.

The first academic session started in April, 1978 with a population of 211 students and 11 senior staff, and 33 junior staff. Federal Polytechnic, Bida is a Federal Government tertiary institution situated in Bida, Niger State, Nigeria. Currently, there are seven faculties in the institution.

Applications are invited from suitably qualified candidates to fill the vacant position below:

Job Position: Director, Procurement

Job Location: Niger

Duties
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	In-charge of purchases and supplies in the Polytechnic, creating and implementing procurement policies and maintaining vendor relationships.
	Overseeing logistics, planning and purchasing to ensure the consistency, cost effectiveness, efficiency and adequacy of the procurement process
	Responsible for overseeing and facilitating the purchasing strategy, supervising teams of subordinates staff in purchasing and ensuring all employees and processes meet the standards and designations for work quality.
	Negotiating contracts and service agreements with suppliers
	Forecasting price trends and prediction
	Maintaining in-depth knowledge of the market to ensure best value and practices are maintained.
	Developing a procurement plan and ensuring that it is clearly communicated
	Forecasting ongoing demand for goods and services
	Monitor, review and analyze bids and quotes with suppliers, works and including the negotiation nof service agreement and contracts
	Oversee sources for purchasing supplies
	Maintain budget and streamline costs.


Qualifications and Experience


	Applicant must possess good Bachelor's Degree/HND (minimum of second class lower/Lower Credit) in Business Administration, Accounting, Marketing, Purchasing and Supply/Procurement and Supply Chain, Quantity Surveying, Banking and Finance, Law, Insurance, Economics or any other relevant discipline with at least 18 years of post academic qualification cognate work experience or a Master's Degree with at least 15 years post academic qualification cognate work experience, and must have a Bureau of Public Procurement conversion/Induction Certificate.
	Must be a person of high integrity who demonstrates transparency in public and private lives and is expected to command the respect and loyalty of staff of the Polytechnic.
	He/She must also be receptive to new ideas and willing to translate the them into action in line with the visions and missions of the Polytechnic.
	Must be a registered member of Institute of Public Procurement Practitioners and any other relevant professional bodies for a minimum of five (5) years.
	Must provide evidence of sustained professional practice and/or administrative leadership.
	Must be conversant with the business of Public Procurement Procedures and guidelines
	Must show evidence of involvement in construction and project management
	Must be able to work under pressure and meet short deadlines.


Terms of Appointment and Conditions of Service


	The appointment is for a single tenure of five years and no more.
	The salary for the position is consolidated while other terms and conditions of appointment are as provided by the conditions of service of the Federal Polytechnics in Nigeria and as may be determined from time to time by the Federal Government of Nigeria or the Governing Council of the Polytechnic.
	The appointee shall enjoy other benefits of office, as may be approved from time to time by the Federal government.


Method of Application
Interest and qualified candidates should submit twenty (20) typewritten copies of their Curriculum Vitae, giving the details in the following order:


	Full Name
	Place and Date of Birth
	State of Origin/Local Government Area
	Nationality
	Current Postal Address
	E-Mail Address and Phone Number
	Marital Status
	Educational Institutions attended with dates
	Academic Qualifications obtained with dates
	Membership of Professional bodies with dates
	Present employer
	Positions held and dates
	Extra-curricular activities
	A statement of his or her own vision for the Polytechnic in the 21st Century.
	Names and addresses of three referees (Employer, Educational and Personal) who should be able to attest to the candidate's claim to high academics, managerial, leadership capabilities, and their notable uprightness.


Applications are to be submitted in a sealed envelope and marked "Application for the post of Director, Medical Services" to:
The Registrar,
The Federal Polytechnic, Bida,
P. M. B. 55,
Niger State.

title: Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) Job at JNO Integrated Services
content:
JNO Integrated Services is a dynamic HR consultancy firm dedicated to helping businesses build strong, efficient, and compliant workforces. We specialize in providing tailored HR solutions, including talent acquisition, employee training, performance management, and HR advisory services. Our team of experts is committed to aligning HR strategies with business goals, ensuring that our clients have the right talent and systems in place to thrive in today’s competitive market.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



At JNO Integrated Services, we understand the complexities of managing people and the importance of compliance with labor laws. We provide strategic guidance and operational support, empowering organizations to maximize employee potential and drive growth. Whether you’re a small business looking to scale or a large corporation seeking to streamline HR processes, we’re here to deliver results.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The HR Business Partner will act as a strategic advisor to management, championing HR initiatives that foster a productive, engaged, and compliant workplace.
	You will support business leaders in workforce planning, talent management, performance development, employee relations, and organizational development.


Job Description


	Partner with department heads to understand business objectives and develop tailored HR solutions
	Lead talent acquisition efforts, ensuring timely and quality hires
	Drive performance management processes, including goal setting, feedback, and appraisals
	Analyze HR metrics to influence data-driven decisions and continuous improvement
	Provide guidance on employee relations, conflict resolution, and disciplinary actions
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, HR policies, and best practices
	Identify training and development needs and support implementation
	Support change management and organizational design initiatives


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (Master’s degree is an advantage)
	5+ years of progressive HR experience, with at least 1 years in a business partnering role
	Strong knowledge of employment laws and HR best practices
	Proven experience in talent management, employee relations, and performance development
	Excellent interpersonal, problem-solving, and communication skills
	Ability to work strategically while managing operational HR tasks.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment.jnoservices@gmail.com using "HR Business Partner – Abuja" as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Jules Construction
content:
Jules Construction Is a construction company with key speciality in home and office improvements/Renovation.With qualified and certified engineers in steel works as well as building construction we are determined to make the experience and process of building to be a memorable one

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Office Manager

Job Location: Shogunle, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Serve as the point person for office manager duties including:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Maintenance
	Mailing
	Supplies
	Equipment
	Bills
	Errands
	Shopping
	Schedule meetings and appointments
	Organize the office layout and order stationery and equipment
	Maintain the office condition and arrange necessary repairs
	Partner with HR to update and maintain office policies as necessary
	Organize office operations and procedures
	Coordinate with IT department on all office equipment
	Ensure that all items are invoiced and paid on time
	Manage contract and price negotiations with office vendors, service providers and office lease
	Manage office G&A budget, ensure accurate and timely reporting
	Provide general support to visitors


Requirements and Skills


	Proven experience as an Office Manager, Front Office Manager or Administrative Assistant
	Knowledge of Office Administrator responsibilities, systems and procedures
	Proficiency in MS Office (MS Excel and MS Outlook, in particular)
	Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work
	Attention to detail and problem solving skills
	Hands on experience with office machines (e.g. fax machines and printers)
	Familiarity with email scheduling tools, like Email Scheduler and Boomerang
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Strong organizational and planning skills in a fast-paced environment
	A creative mind with an ability to suggest improvements.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 20th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: portal.julesconst.net@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Administrative officer

Job Location: Shogunle, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Manage office supplies stock and place orders
	Prepare regular reports on expenses and office budgets
	Maintain and update company databases
	Organize a filing system for important and confidential company documents
	Answer queries by employees and clients
	Distribute and store correspondence (e.g. letters, emails and packages)
	Prepare reports and presentations with statistical data, as assigned
	Update office policies as needed
	Maintain a company calendar and schedule appointments
	Book meeting rooms as required
	Arrange travel and accommodations
	Schedule in-house and external events


Requirements and skills


	High school diploma; additional qualifications in Office Administration are a plus
	Proven work experience as an Administrative Officer, Administrator or similar role
	Solid knowledge of office procedures
	Experience with office management software like MS Office (MS Excel and MS Word, specifically)
	Strong organization skills with a problem-solving attitude
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Attention to detail


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 20th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: portal.julesconst.net@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Civil Engineer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	A Civil Engineer manages construction projects, conducts site investigations, assesses risks, and ensures safe project completion. 
	They collaborate with stakeholders, provide technical expertise, and oversee structure implementation. Strong project management, communication, and engineering skills are essential. Experience, a professional license


Responsibilities


	Manage, design, develop, create and maintain small-scale through to large-scale construction projects in a safe, timely and sustainable manner
	Conduct on site investigations and analyze data (maps, reports, tests, drawings and other)
	Carry out technical and feasibility studies and draw up blueprints that satisfy technical specifications
	Assess potential risks, materials and costs
	Provide advice and resolve creatively any emerging problems/deficiencies
	Oversee and mentor staff and liaise with a variety of stakeholders
	Handle over the resulting structures and services for use
	Monitor progress and compile reports in project status
	Manage budget and purchase equipment/materials
	Comply with guidelines and regulations including permits, safety etc and deliver technical files and other technical documentation as required.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / HND / B.Sc Degree with 2 - 8 years of work experience.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 14th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: portal.julesconst.net@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
